instructions: Grab a barbell with a shoulder width pronated or supinated grip.\
Bend forward at your hips while maintaining a flat back.\
Pull the weight toward your upper abdomen.\
Lower the weight in a controlled manner and repeat.\

female.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Reverse Curl - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Reverse Curl - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Take a double overhand grip that's about shoulder width. Flex your elbows while keeping your elbows tucked in. Try not to let them flare out.\
Curl until your forearm presses into your bicep. Then fully extend your elbows at the bottom of each rep.\

exercises.title: Barbell Landmine Row

male.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Landmine Row - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Landmine Row - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Landmine Row - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Landmine Row - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.\
Grasp the end of the barbell with a neutral grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.\
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.\
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.\

female.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Long Landmine Row - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing it with your feet shoulder-width apart.\
Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.\
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.\
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.\

exercises.title: Barbell Meadows Row

male.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Meadows Row - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Meadows Row - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Meadows Row - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Position a barbell in a landmine or corner of a room and stand facing sideways with a staggered stance and your feet shoulder-width apart.\
Grasp the end of the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your arms straight and your shoulders relaxed.\
Bend at the hips and knees to lower your torso until it is almost parallel to the ground.\
Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you row the weight up.\
*Named after the late John Meadows\

exercises.title: Barbell Pronated Pendlay Row

female.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Pronated Pendlay Row - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Pronated Pendlay Row - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Start hinged forward with a flat back and the plates resting on the floor. Make sure your elbows are fully extended.\
Pull the bar to your sternum.\
Return the plates back to the floor and let the bar come to a full dead stop.\
Then initiate the next rep.\

exercises.title: Barbell Pronated Row

male.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Pronated Row - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Pronated Row - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Pronated Row - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Pronated Row - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Grab the barbell with an overhand grip. Hinge forward while keeping your back flat until your torso is about parallel with the ground.\
Let your arms hang freely.\
Pull the bar to your torso while tucking your elbows in slightly.\
Extend your elbows fully before initiating the next rep.\

exercises.title: Barbell Supinated Pendlay Row

male.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Supinated Pendlay Row - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Supinated Pendlay Row - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Supinated Pendlay Row - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Supinated Pendlay Row - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Begin by standing in front of a barbell with your feet about hip-width apart and your palms facing towards your body.\
Bend at the hips and knees to grab the barbell with a pronated (overhand) grip, positioning the barbell about an inch away from your shins.\
Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, use your back muscles to lift the barbell straight up towards your chest.\
As the barbell reaches your chest, rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing towards your body (supinated grip), and then lower the barbell back to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Supinated Row

male.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Supinated Row - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Biceps - Barbell Supinated Row - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Biceps - Barbell Supinated Row - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Begin by standing in front of a barbell with your feet about hip-width apart.\
Bend at the hips and knees to grab the barbell with a supinated (underhand) grip, positioning the barbell about an inch away from your shins.\
Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, use your back muscles to lift the barbell straight up towards your chest.\
As the barbell reaches your chest, pause briefly, and then lower the barbell back to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Landmine Bicep Curl

male.side: videos/Biceps - Landmine Bicep Curl - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Biceps - Landmine Bicep Curl - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Biceps - Landmine Bicep Curl - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Stand beside the landmine with your feet shoulder-width apart while grasping the end of the landmine barbell with the hand farther away from the landmine attachment, palm facing up and your elbow close to your side.\
Curl the barbell up towards your opposite shoulder, contracting your bicep muscles, then slowly lower the barbell back down.\
Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.\

female.side: videos/Biceps - Landmine Concentration Curl - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Start on one knee facing the landmine, holding the end of the barbell with your hand on the side of your forward leg.\
While keeping your elbow braced against the inside of your knee, curl the barbell upward towards your shoulder, then lower it back down with control.\
Repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.\

instructions: Lie down on your back with your legs straight and arms at your sides.\
Close your eyes and take deep breaths in through your nose and out through your mouth.\
Allow your body to completely relax and let go of any tension.\
Hold for several minutes and then slowly come back up to a seated position.\

exercises.title: Crow Pose

male.side: videos/Biceps - Crow Pose - Male-side.mp4

instructions: Begin in a squatting position with your feet together and your knees apart.\
Place your hands on the floor in front of you, shoulder-width apart. Keep your arms straight and engage your core.\
Slowly shift your weight forward and lift your feet off the ground, coming onto your tiptoes.\
Bend your elbows and lean your weight onto your hands, shifting your knees towards your upper arms.\
Gently lift one foot off the ground, and then the other, balancing on your hands. Hold the pose for a few breaths before releasing back to the ground.\

exercises.title: Downward Dog

male.side: videos/Biceps - Downward Dog - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Biceps - Downward Dog - Female-front.mp4

instructions: Begin on your hands and knees with your hands shoulder-width apart and your knees hip-width apart.\
Spread your fingers wide and press down into your palms, making sure that your fingers are evenly spaced and facing forward.\
Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the ground, straightening your legs as much as possible.\
Press your hips up and back, bringing your body into an inverted \\
Keep your arms straight and your shoulder blades spread apart, and try to press your heels down towards the ground.\
Hold the pose for several breaths, then release and return to your starting position.\

exercises.title: Downward Dog With Fingers Facing Feet

instructions: Begin in the same starting position as the previous exercise, with your hands and knees on the ground.\
Spread your fingers wide and turn your hands so that your fingers are facing towards your feet.\
Tuck your toes under and lift your knees off the ground, straightening your legs as much as possible.\
Press your hips up and back, bringing your body into an inverted \\
Keep your arms straight and your shoulder blades spread apart, and try to press your heels down towards the ground.\
Hold the pose for several breaths, then release and return to your starting position.\

instructions: Begin in a downward-facing dog pose.\
Slowly lift one leg up towards the ceiling, keeping your hips level and your toes pointed.\
Bend your lifted leg and try to touch your toes to the back of your head.\
Once you have a firm grip with your toes, slowly begin to twist your torso towards the lifted leg.\
Keep your hands and feet firmly planted on the ground as you hold the pose for a few breaths. Release the pose and repeat on the other side.\

exercises.title: Seated Arm Stretch

instructions: Sit cross-legged on the floor.\
Extend your arms straight out in front of you, palms facing forward.\
Cross your right arm over your left arm and interlace your fingers.\
Pull your hands away from your body and hold for a few breaths, then release and repeat with the opposite arm on top.\

Do a light hop and bring your feet outward while simultaneously flexing the elbows.\
Bring both feet back together and extend the elbows.\

Push with legs, lean back slightly, pull handle to lower ribs.\
Extend arms, lean forward from hips, bend knees to return to start.\

Pull your elbows straight back and let the bar drag against your upper body (or very close to it).\

male.side: videos/Biceps - Smith Machine Underhand Row - Male-side.mp4

instructions: Begin by standing in front of a bar with your feet about hip-width apart.\
Bend at the hips and knees to grab the bar with a supinated (underhand) grip, positioning the bar about an inch away from your shins.\
Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, use your back muscles to lift the bar straight up towards your chest.\
As the bar reaches your chest, pause briefly, and then lower the bar back to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Smith Machine Overhand Row

male.front: videos/Biceps - Smith Machine Overhand Row - Male-front.mp4

instructions: Start hinged forward with a flat back. Make sure your elbows are fully extended.\
Pull the bar to your sternum.\

exercises.title: Seated Ulnar Nerve Tensioner
instructions: Abduct your arm at 90 palm facing down.\
Bend your elbow and wrist to bring the palm to face the ceiling while leaning the head towards the opposite shoulder.\
Find the position of maximum tension (without pain) and hold.\
To increase the stretch, press the palm against the face and try to point the elbow up.\

exercises.title: Seated Ulnar Nerve Slider
instructions: Abduct your arm at 90 palm facing down.\
Bend your elbow and wrist bringing your front of your fingertips to your temple while leaning the head towards the the arm.\
Lean the head away from the arm as you extend the elbow and flex the wrist.\
Alternate between positions to mobilise the ulnar nerve.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Service Exercise
instructions: Stand up straight and hold a dumbbell in one arm. Perform a bicep curl across your body\
Bring the dumbbell to your shoulder and rotate palm and elbow out.\
Point the elbow towards the ceiling while the dumbbell remains just over the shoulder.\
Extend your elbow to raise the dumbbell over your head. Start lowering your arm to your side as you turn the palm to face down\

exercises.title: Core Stability 2 Opposite Shoulder Tap 4Pt Position

male.front: videos/Biceps - Core Stability 2 Opposite Shoulder Tap 4Pt Position - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Biceps - Core Stability 2 Opposite Shoulder Tap 4Pt Position - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Biceps - Core Stability 2 Opposite Shoulder Tap 4Pt Position - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Biceps - Core Stability 2 Opposite Shoulder Tap 4Pt Position - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Bring yourself to the 4 point position (on all fours). 90 angles at hips and shoulder and neutral spine.\
Lift your knees slightly off the ground supporting your weight on palms and toes.\
Maintain a toe placement roughly at shoulder width (the wider the leg stance the easier the exercise - the narrower the stance the more difficult it becomes.\
Tap your opposite shoulder with your fingertips.\

exercises.title: Barbell High Pull
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width, and keep your back straight.\
Drive through your legs, extending your hips, knees, and ankles explosively while pulling the barbell upward.\
As the bar rises, pull it close to your body, leading with your elbows until it reaches chest level.\

exercises.title: Barbell Snatch Grip High Pull
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, gripping the barbell with a wide (snatch-width) grip. Keep your back straight, chest up, and bar close to your body.\
Drive through your legs, extending your hips, knees, and ankles while pulling the barbell up explosively.\
Shrug your shoulders forcefully and pull the bar as high as possible, keeping elbows above the bar.\
Lower the bar back to the starting position in a controlled manner and reset for the next rep.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Row Bilateral
instructions: Grab both dumbbells and hinge forward at the hips. Make sure you keep a flat back.\
The closer your torso is to parallel with the ground the longer the range of motion will be at your shoulder. The better the results you'll get from the exercise.\
Let your arms hang freely, and then pull your elbow joint straight back toward the ceiling.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Row Unilateral
instructions: Brace your off arm against something stable (bench, box). Stagger your stance so your leg on the side of your working arm is back.\
Try to get your torso to parallel with the ground. That will extend your range of motion.\
Let your arm hang freely and then pull your elbow back. Imagine you've got a tennis ball in your armpit and squeeze it each rep.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Laying Silverback Shrug
instructions: Lay on an incline bench with your arms hanging freely.\
Pull your shoulder blades back toward the ceiling.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Silverback Shrug
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding dumbbells with both hands in front just past shoulder width.\
Bend forward at the hips with a slight bend in your knees, keeping your back straight.\
Engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Seated Rear Delt Row
instructions: Sit on a bench. Put your chest in your lap. Try to get your torso as close to parallel with the ground as your mobility will allow for.\
Let your arms hang in front of you. Pull your elbows back towards the ceiling while flaring your elbows outward.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Weighted Pull Ups
instructions: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended.\
Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.\
Lower your body back to starting position.\

exercises.title: Pull Ups
instructions: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended.\
Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.\
Lower your body back to starting position.\

exercises.title: Inverted Row
instructions: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip.\
Pull your body straight up to the bar.\
Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.\

exercises.title: Elevated Pike Press
instructions: Use a bench or an object to elevate your feet.\
Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows\
Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Pike Press
instructions: Start in a plank position. Push your hips up toward the ceiling.\
Lower your head towards the floor by bending your elbows\
Push through your hands and return to the starting pike position.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Overhand Inverted Row
instructions: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip.\
Pull your body straight up to the bar.\
Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Standing Inverted Row
instructions: Grab a door frame or a rack and place your feet near the frame.\
Start with your elbows extended, row your body towards your hands.\
Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.\

exercises.title: L Sit Pull Up
instructions: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. Pull your legs up until you're in an \\
Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.\
Lower your body back to starting position.\

exercises.title: Ring Pull Up
instructions: Grasp the rings with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended.\
Pull your body up until your chin is above the rings.\
Lower your body back to starting position.\

exercises.title: Machine Plate Loaded Low Row
instructions: Press your chest into the chest pad and grab the horizontal handles with an overhand grip.\
Pull the handles toward you, make sure your elbows stay flared out.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Deadlift (Single)
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.\
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.\
Return to standing position and repeat.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Silverback Shrug (Single)
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your thighs.\
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees, keeping your back straight.\
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Incline Shrug
instructions: Leaning across the back section of the bench, with feet firmly on the floor and with arms hanging to the sides.\
Holding the kettlebell in both hands engage your shoulder blades, as if you are trying to touch them together. Release the shrug.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Silverback Shrug
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, hold one kettlebell in each hand at your sides, and lean forward.\
Lift your shoulders backward while keeping arms straight.\
Lower shoulders back down, repeat for desired reps.\

exercises.title: Traps mid back Stretch Variation Two
instructions: Sit on the ground and lay one leg flat and the other over the top.\
Hold your leg with the same side arm and slowly rotate your hips and back.\
Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position.\
Switch sides and repeat.\

exercises.title: Traps mid back Stretch Variation One
instructions: Stand up with your feet shoulder width apart. Place one arm across the front of your chest at shoulder height, press the forearm of your other arm above the elbow, hooking the stretching arm with your hand.\
Press the arm until it is straight and rotate your upper torso to engage the stretch even deeper.\
Repeat with your other arm.\

exercises.title: Cable Silverback Shrug
instructions: Use a bar attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the bottom.\
Stand up with the attachment in hand, walk a couple of steps back make sure you are standing upright and not leaning backwards.\
Retract your shoulder blades and then protract to return to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Cable Single Arm Rear Delt Row
instructions: Use a handle attachment, grab with an overhand grip and take a position with the cable crossing your body.\
Pull your elbows back while flaring your elbows outward.\

exercises.title: Band Horizontal Shrug
instructions: Anchor the band at shoulder height. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.\
Retract your shoulder blades straight back in schools. Then protract to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Band Pull Apart
instructions: Grab the band with a shoulder width grip. Point your arms straight in front of you.\
Retract your shoulder blades and shoulder joint until the band taps your chest.\

exercises.title: Band High Face Pull
instructions: Start with a band anchored to a high point. Stagger your stance.\
Pull the band to the bridge of your nose.\

exercises.title: Band Rear Delt Fly
instructions: Start by standing between the two anchored bands with your feet shoulder-width apart and the bands positioned at a high point.\
Grasp the ends of each band with your hands, keeping your palms facing each other.\

Keeping your arms slightly bent and your back straight, slowly pull the bands away from your body until your arms are extended straight out to the sides. Hold for a second, then slowly release back to the starting position. Repeat for desired reps.\

exercises.title: Plate Internally Rotated Rear Delt Fly
instructions: With plates in either hand, bend your knees with your feet slightly bowed out. Hinge forward with a flat back.\
Maintain an overhand grip and internally rotated shoulders.\
Raise your arms backward toward the ceiling while maintaining a light band in your elbows.\

exercises.title: Plate Rear Delt Fly
instructions: Keep your back straight and bend forward slightly at the waist.\
With arms extended, raise the weights out to your sides until they are in line with your shoulders.\
Pause briefly and then lower the weights back to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Plate Weighted Inverted Row
instructions: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip. Place a plate on your chest.\
Pull your body straight up to the bar.\
Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.\

exercises.title: Weighted Pull Ups
instructions: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. Weight hanging between your legs.\
Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar.\
Lower your body back to starting position.\

exercises.title: TRX Rear Delt Fly
instructions: Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands.\
Step forward so that your body is in a plank position, with your arms straight and your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.\
Keeping your arms straight, slowly lift your arms out to the side, keeping them at the same height as your shoulders. Your body should form a \\

exercises.title: TRX Rear Delt Row
instructions: Stand facing away from the TRX straps and grab the handles with both hands.\
Step away so your body is leaning away from the anchor point.\
Flex your elbows and pull your elbows straight back behind your body.\
Make sure to keep your elbows flared outward.\

exercises.title: TRX W Raise
instructions: Hold the TRX straps and lean away from the anchor point.\
Pull your elbows back while externally rotating your shoulder joint. Your arms should make a W shape at the back portion of the exercise.\

exercises.title: Cat Pose
instructions: Begin on your hands and knees with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.\
Inhale and arch your back, lifting your tailbone and head towards the ceiling, while lowering your belly towards the floor.\
Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin towards your chest, and bringing your tailbone towards your knees.\
Repeat these movements, flowing smoothly between the two poses, for several breaths.\

exercises.title: Easy Seated Twist Pose
instructions: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you.\
Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh.\
Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling.\
Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.\

exercises.title: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands Beginner
instructions: Begin in a low lunge position with your right foot forward and your left knee on the ground.\
Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart.\
Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee.\
Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.\

exercises.title: Revolved Side Angle Pose With Prayer Hands
instructions: Begin in Warrior II pose, with your right foot forward and your left foot back.\
Bring your hands together in a prayer position at your heart.\
Exhale and twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee.\
Hold for several breaths and then repeat on the other side.\

exercises.title: Seated Twist
instructions: Begin seated with your legs extended in front of you.\
Bend your right knee and place your foot on the floor next to your left thigh.\
Inhale and reach your left arm up towards the ceiling.\
Exhale and twist to the right, placing your left elbow on the outside of your right knee. Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.\

exercises.title: Smith Machine Inverted Row
instructions: Lay underneath a fixed horizontal bar and grab the bar with a wide overhand grip.\
Pull your body straight up to the bar.\
Return to the starting position, your arms fully extended. Repeat.\

exercises.title: Smith Machine Assisted Pullup
instructions: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms and shoulders fully extended. Leave your feet on the floor.\
Pull your body up until your chin is above the bar. Use your legs top assist you up.\
Lower your body back to starting position.\

exercises.title: Laying Ts
instructions: Lie on your front, arms outstretched to the side.\
Raise head and chest off the ground.\
Raise and lower your arms (flapping wings motion) by contracting and relaxing the muscles in between your shoulder blades.\

exercises.title: Scapular Retraction
instructions: From the standing or seated position straighten your back.\
Pull the shoulders back but keep them relaxed.\
Move shoulders backwards and return to the starting, relaxed position.\

exercises.title: Barbell High Bar Good Morning
instructions: Place the bar on your traps. You may need a pad so the bar doesn't dig into your cervical spine.\
Push your hips straight back. Your knees should stay MOSTLY extended (think soft knees). Also make sure to\
Look for what feels like a stretch in your hamstrings. The stretch feeling means you're likely nearing the end of your Range of Motion without rounding your spine.\
When you feel the stretch push your hips forward until you're in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Low Bar Good Morning
instructions: Place the bar between your traps and rear delts. Pull your shoulder blades back to give the bar a shelf to sit on.\
Push your hips back until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. This means you're nearing the end of your Range of Motion with out rounding your spine.\
When you feel the stretch push your hips forward until you'e in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Sumo Deadlift
instructions: Stance width can vary with a sumo DL. Some prefer toes near the plates. Others prefer a more narrow stance to get more drive off the floor.\
Make sure your arms are inside your legs. The bar should be just over your mid-foot. Flatten your back and push your heels into the floor.\
Try to extend your knees and hips simultaneously.\

exercises.title: Barbell Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Take a shoulder width, double overhand or mixed grip.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Low Bar Squat
instructions: Pull your shoulder blades back really hard and place the bar on your posterior delts.\
Push your hips back and break at the knees to initiate the squat.\
Aim to get your hamstrings to parallel with the ground. Push your heels into the floor and squat back up to a standing position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Coan Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place a barbell on the floor in front of you.\
Bend at the hips and knees to grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands just outside of your hips.\
Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, lift the barbell off the floor by extending your hips and knees.\
As you lift the barbell, pull your shoulders back and squeeze your glutes to fully extend your hips at the top of the movement.\

exercises.title: Barbell Pause Box Squat
instructions: Stand in front of a box or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell resting on your upper back.\
Lower your body into a squat position, sitting back onto the box and pausing for a moment before standing back up.\
Push through your heels to return to the standing position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Pause Squat
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell resting on your upper back.\
Lower your body into a squat position, pausing for a moment at the bottom of the movement before standing back up.\
Push through your heels to return to the standing position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Reverse Deadlift
instructions: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with your toes pointed slightly outward.\
Place a barbell on the floor behind you, with the weight plates on either side.\
Bend down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and your shoulders down as you grip the bar.\
Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the ground and pulling it toward your hips. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down as you do this.\

exercises.title: Barbell Snatch Grip Deadlift
instructions: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart, with your toes pointed slightly outward.\
Place a barbell on the floor in front of you, with the weight plates on either side. Make sure that the bar is directly in line with your feet.\
Bend down and grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands much wider than shoulder-width apart. Keep your back straight and your shoulders down as you grip the bar.\
Stand up straight, lifting the barbell off the ground and pulling it toward your hips. Keep your elbows close to your body and your shoulders down as you do this.\
Slowly lower the barbell back to the ground, making sure to keep your back straight and your shoulders down throughout the movement.\

exercises.title: Barbell Snatch Grip Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Start by standing with your feet about hip-width apart. The bar should be in a rack or box so it's lifted off the ground.\
Grab the barbell with an overhand grip, your hands should be much wider than shoulder-width apart.\
Hing forward at the hips keeping your knees mostly extended. Hinge until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you are back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Suitcase Deadlift
instructions: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a barbell at one side of your body, with your palms facing your thighs.\
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and knees to lower the barbell down towards the ground.\
As the barbell reaches the ground, use your legs and glutes to push through your heels and extend your hips and knees to raise your body back to the starting position.\
Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with the barbell on the opposite side of your body.\

exercises.title: Barbell Zercher Good Morning
instructions: Begin by standing with your feet about hip-width apart and holding a barbell in the crook of your elbows, with your palms facing towards your body.\
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and lower your torso forward until it is nearly parallel to the ground.\
Push through your heels to extend your hips and raise your body back to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Zercher Squat
instructions: Begin by standing with your feet about hip-width apart and holding a barbell in the crook of your arms, near your belly. Your palms should be facing towards your body.\
Sit back and lower your body down until your thighs are parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.\
Push through your heels to extend your hips and stand back up to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Landmine Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Stand in front of the landmine with your feet hip-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Grasp the landmine barbell with both hands, palms facing each other, and hold it in front of your thighs.\

Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, hinge at the hips and push your hips back, allowing the landmine to travel down your thighs. Lower the landmine by bending forward at the hips while keeping your back flat, allowing the barbell to move closer to the floor. Continue the movement until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, keeping your legs relatively straight but with a slight bend in the knees.\
Reverse the movement by pushing your hips forward and driving through your heels while keeping your back straight.\
Repeat for the desired number of reps.\

exercises.title: Landmine Single Leg Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Grab the end of the landmine and stand perpendicular to the bar.\
Lift your inside leg and keep your outside leg planted.\
Push your hips back keeping your knees mostly extended. When you feel the stretch in your hams, push your hips forward until you are standing upright.\

exercises.title: Landmine Snatch
instructions: Hold the end of the bar in front of you.\
Pop your hips, pull your elbows up to the ceiling, and get underneath the bar.\

exercises.title: Landmine Staggered Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Stand in a staggered position. With the back leg bent and the front mostly extended.\
Push your hips back until you feel a stretch through your front hamstring.\
Push your hips back forward until you are standing.\

exercises.title: Barbell Suitcase Carry
instructions: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart with the bar on the ground at your side.\
Lift the bar to your side and walk for the allotted amount of time or distance.\
Set the bar down and switch sides.\

exercises.title: Barbell Sumo Pause Deadlift
instructions: Set up for a sumo deadlift, grip the barbell.\
Lift, pause at knee height.\
Hold briefly, then complete the lift; reset and repeat for desired reps.\

exercises.title: Barbell Jefferson Deadlift
instructions: Stand centered over the barbell, feet shoulder-width apart.\
Grip the bar with both hands, one in front, one behind.\
Lift by driving through your heels, keeping your back straight, then lower slowly.\

exercises.title: Barbell Conventional Pause Deadlift
instructions: Set up for a standard deadlift, grip the barbell.\
Lift, pause at knee height.\
Hold briefly, then complete the lift; reset and repeat for desired reps.\

exercises.title: Barbell Block Conventional Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your mid-foot under the bar, plates should be on blocks, and grip the bar with your hands, about a shoulder width apart.\
Bend your knees, then lift the bar by straightening your back. It is important to keep your back straight.\
Stand to your full height and hold.\
Lower the bar to the floor by bending your knees and keeping your back straight.\

exercises.title: Barbell Deficit Conventional Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your mid-foot under the bar, feet should be on a plate or elevated platform, and grip the bar with your hands, about a shoulder width apart.\
Bend your knees, then lift the bar by straightening your back. It is important to keep your back straight.\
Stand to your full height and hold.\
Lower the bar to the floor by bending your knees and keeping your back straight.\

exercises.title: Barbell Muscle Snatch
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, grip the barbell with a wide overhand grip, and keep your back straight and core engaged.\
Lift the barbell by explosively extending your hips, knees, and ankles while keeping the bar close to your body.\
As the bar reaches chest level, rotate your wrists and elbows up and back, transitioning into an overhead press.\
Fully extend your arms overhead, stabilize the bar, then lower it back to the starting position with control.\

exercises.title: Barbell Power Snatch
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell over midfoot. Grip the bar wide (outside shoulders), hook grip recommended.\
Keep chest up, back straight, and drive through heels to lift the bar off the ground, keeping it close to your body.\
As the bar reaches mid-thigh, explode upwards by extending hips, knees, and ankles, shrugging shoulders and pulling the bar high.\
Drop under the bar slightly, catching it overhead with arms locked out. Stand up fully to complete the lift.\

exercises.title: Barbell Clean And Jerk
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, grip the bar just outside your knees. Pull the bar from the floor by driving through your legs, keeping your back straight.\
As the bar reaches your hips, extend explosively, shrug, and drop under to catch it in a front squat position with elbows high. Stand up tall.\
Dip slightly, then drive through your legs to push the bar overhead.\
Stabilize the bar overhead, lock arms, then bring feet together before lowering the bar safely.\

exercises.title: Barbell Snatch
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell over midfoot. Grip the bar wide with an overhand grip, chest up, and back straight.\
Lift the bar by driving through your legs, keeping it close to your body. Extend your hips and knees while maintaining a straight back.\
Explosively extend your hips, knees, and ankles while shrugging your shoulders. Pull yourself under the bar as it moves upward.\
Drop into a deep squat while locking the bar overhead. Stabilize, then stand up fully to complete the lift.\

exercises.title: Barbell Zercher Deficit Lunge
instructions: Begin by standing with your feet on a plate and holding a barbell in the crook of your arms, near your belly. Your palms should be facing towards your body.\
Step back with one foot off the plate and lower your back knee to the floor.\
Push through your front leg and bring your back foot to the plate.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Goblet Good Morning
instructions: Hold the dumbbell in a goblet position. With your elbows directly under your fists.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knees MOSTLY extended. You should feel a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Stand with a shoulder width stance. Push your butt back while leaving your knees MOSTLY extended.\
You should feel a stretch in your hamstrings. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward to complete the rep.\
Do not push your hips all the way forward. This will hyperextend your spine. Just go to a normal standing position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Front Rack Pause Squat
instructions: Place two dumbbells on your shoulders and make sure you force your elbows upward.\
Push your hips back and break at the knees.\
When you reach parallel (hamstrings parallel with the ground) pause for 1-3 seconds. Then push through your heels back to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Single Leg Single Arm Deadlift
instructions: Start by standing on one leg with a dumbbell in one hand.\
Slowly bend at the hips and lower the dumbbell towards the ground while extending your free leg behind you.\
Keep your core engaged and your back straight as you lower the weight.\
Once the dumbbell is close to the ground, push through your heel to return to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Single Leg Stiff Leg Deadlift
instructions: Start by standing on one leg with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding two dumbbells.\
From this starting position, hinge at the hips to lower the dumbbell towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.\
Once you feel a stretch in your hamstring, slowly return to the starting position.\
Make sure to keep your standing leg slightly bent and avoid rounding your back as you lower the dumbbell.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Staggered Deadlift
instructions: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.\
Place one foot slightly behind the other, with the heel of your back foot elevated on a step or weight plate.\
From this starting position, bend at the hips and knees to lower the dumbbells towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.\
Once the dumbbells are below your knees, drive through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Sumo Squat
instructions: Start by standing with your feet wider than shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in each hand.\
Place the dumbbells on the ground between your feet.\
From this starting position, bend your knees and lower your body down into a squat.\
Make sure to keep your core engaged and your back straight throughout the movement.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Swing
instructions: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a dumbbell in both hands.\
Bend your knees slightly and hinge at the hips to swing the dumbbell between your legs.\
From this starting position, explosively extend your hips and swing the dumbbell up to chest height.\
Allow the momentum of the swing to carry the dumbbell back down between your legs, and then repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Superman
instructions: Lay flat on the ground on your stomach with your arms extended overhead. Hold a dumbbell with a neutral grip.\
Lift your legs and chest off the ground simultaneously and hold for a 1 count at the top.\
Relax your lower back and lower your legs and chest back to the floor.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Superman Hold
instructions: Lie face down on a mat.\
Hold dumbbells out in front\
Lift arms and legs simultaneously, squeezing lower back.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Cross Body Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Stand with a shoulder width stance holding one dumbbell. Push your butt back while leaving your knees MOSTLY extended.\
Reach toward the opposing leg. You should feel a stretch in your hamstrings. When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward to complete the rep.\
Do not push your hips all the way forward. This will hyperextend your spine. Just go to a normal standing position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Box Squat
instructions: Stand in front of a box or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart with a dumbbell in a goblet position.\
Lower your body into a squat position, sitting back onto the box and pausing for a moment before standing back up.\
Push through your heels to return to the standing position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Staggered Waiters Bow
instructions: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar.\
Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.\
Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Waiters Bow
instructions: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Place one knee on a bench and hold a dumbbell.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Half Kneeling Goblet Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Place one knee on a bench and hold a dumbbell in a goblet position.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Good Mornings
instructions: Stand with your feet a little past shoulder width apart with a slight bend at your knee. Place your hands behind the back of your head.\
Keeping your back straight, rotate your hips to bring your shoulders down towards the floor. Stop when your chest is parallel with the floor.\

exercises.title: Supermans
instructions: Lie face down on the floor with your arms fully extended in front of you.\
Simultaneously raise your arms, legs and chest off of the floor and hold the position.\
Slowly lower your arms, legs and chest back to the starting position. Repeat.\

exercises.title: Single Legged Romanian Deadlifts
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent and raise one leg.\
Without changing the bend in your knee, bend at your hips, and lower your torso until it's almost parallel to the floor.\
Tense your glutes and then bring yourself back to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Staggered Waiters Bow
instructions: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar.\
Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.\
Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Waiters Bow
instructions: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Stability Ball Reverse Hyperextension
instructions: Lie face down on a stability ball, hands on the floor, legs extended straight.\
Engage glutes and lower back, raising legs until aligned with your torso.\
Slowly lower legs back down without touching the ground, maintaining core engagement. Repeat.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Stability Ball Hyperextension
instructions: Lie face-down on a stability ball, hips centered, feet anchored, hands behind your head.\
Engage your core, lift your upper body until aligned with legs, keeping your neck neutral.\
Lower your torso slowly back to the starting position, maintaining control and steady breathing.\

exercises.title: Half Kneeling Hip Hinge
instructions: Place one knee on a bench.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Machine 45 Degree Back Extension
instructions: Position your thighs on the padding and hook your feet on the platform supports.\
Keeping your back straight, slowly bend at your waist until your legs and back are at a 45 angle.\
Slowly raise your body to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Machine Back Extension
instructions: Sit on the machine and place your upper back on the rolling pad.\
Extend your hips and lower back. Make sure not to hyperextend your spine.\

exercises.title: Machine Reverse Hyperextension
instructions: Lay on the pad and grab the handles.\
Slip your legs into the belt loop.\
Push your legs back until they are horizontal with the ground.\
Lower back to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Medicine Ball Single Leg Deadlift
instructions: Hold medicine ball while standing on one leg.\
Hinge forward on one leg, extending other leg behind.\
Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Swing
instructions: Stand with your feet slightly wider than shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell between your legs, with your knees slightly bent.\
Keeping your back straight, swing the kettlebell upwards until the kettlebell is level with your chest and carefully lower.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Single Leg Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, lifting one foot off the floor behind you. Hold the kettlebell in the same arm as the lifted leg.\
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you extend your lifted leg behind you, keeping your back straight - holding out your arm to the side for balance.\
Return to the upright position and repeat.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Staggered Deadlift (Single)
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart, shifting one foot behind you. Hold the kettlebell in both hands in front of your thighs.\
Bend forward at the hips bringing the kettlebell to the floor while you slightly bend your knees and keep your back straight.\
Return to the upright position and repeat.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Goblet Good Morning
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder width apart holding the kettlebell with both hands in front of your chest.\
Bend forward at the hips keeping your back and knees straight and the kettlebell close to your chest.\
Return to standing position and thrust your pelvis forward.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Superman
instructions: Begin by lying face down on the floor with a kettlebell in each hand, arms extended.\
Lift your chest and legs off the ground simultaneously while squeezing your glutes and raising the kettlebells.\
Lower your body and kettlebells back to the floor, then repeat for the desired number of reps.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Superman Hold
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, kettlebell in one hand, arm fully extended, and hinge at hips.\
Lift opposite leg straight behind you, forming a straight line from head to heel.\
Hold for 15-30 seconds, switch sides, and repeat for a balanced kettlebell superman hold.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Alternating Swing
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs.\
Hinge at hips, swing kettlebell between legs.\
Swing kettlebell up, switch hands at the top, and repeat in a fluid motion.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Conventional Deadlift (Double)
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart.\
Bend at hips and knees to lift kettlebells.\
Stand tall, then lower.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Swing (Double)
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebells outside legs\
Hinge at hips, swing kettlebells forward, then back.\
Thrust hips to swing kettlebells upward, keeping arms straight.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Full Swing
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs.\
Hinge at hips, grip kettlebell, and swing it overhead.\
Extend hips and knees, lock out arms at the top.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding kettlebells in front.\
Hinge at hips, keeping back straight, and lower kettlebells towards ground.\
Return to start position, squeezing glutes at the top.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Single Arm Swing
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, kettlebell between legs, grip with one hand, hinge at hips.\
Swing kettlebell forcefully forward, using hip thrust, arm straight.\
Swing kettlebell back between legs, repeat for desired reps.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Staggered Deadlift
instructions: Begin with feet hip-width apart, one foot forward, kettlebell between feet.\
Hinge at hips, grip kettlebell, and stand tall.\
Lower kettlebell with control, then repeat.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Staggered Swing
instructions: Lower kettlebell with control, then repeat.\
Explosively thrust hips forward, swing kettlebell to chest height.\
Repeat for desired reps, keeping core engaged and maintaining a staggered stance for balance.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift
instructions: Stand with feet wide apart, toes pointing slightly outward, and kettlebell on the floor between your feet.\
Bend at hips and knees, keeping back straight, and grip the kettlebell handle.\
Lift the kettlebell by extending hips and knees, stand up straight, and return to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Swing To Upright Row
instructions: Start with a kettlebell between your legs, hinge at hips, swing it upward.\
Lift kettlebell to chest level, elbows high, engaging shoulders.\
Lower kettlebell back down, maintaining control. Repeat for desired reps.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Suitcase Deadlift
instructions: Begin by standing with your feet hip-width apart and holding a kettlebell at one side of your body, with your palms facing your thighs.\
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and knees to lower the kettlebell down towards the ground.\
As the kettlebell reaches the ground, use your legs and glutes to push through your heels and extend your hips and knees to raise your body back to the starting position.\
Repeat the movement for the desired number of reps, then switch sides and repeat the exercise with the kettlebell on the opposite side of your body.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Box Squat
instructions: Stand in front of a box or bench with your feet shoulder-width apart with a kettlebell in a goblet position.\
Lower your body into a squat position, sitting back onto the box and pausing for a moment before standing back up.\
Push through your heels to return to the standing position.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Staggered Waiters Bow
instructions: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar.\
Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.\
Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Waiters Bow
instructions: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Half Kneeling Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Place one knee on a bench and hold a kettlebell.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Half Kneeling Goblet Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Place one knee on a bench and hold a kettlebell in a goblet position.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knee mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Lower back Stretch Variation Four
instructions: Lay flat against the ground with your knees at an angle and your feet flat against the floor.\
Grab your legs just below the knees, and pull your legs towards your chest.\
Pause at the apex of the stretch, then return to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Lower back Stretch Variation Three
instructions: Lay on your back with your arms at either side.\
Raise your knees so that they are pointing straight towards the ceiling. Keeping your legs pressed together, rotate your hips to either side.\
Repeat this motion as necessary.\

exercises.title: Lower back Stretch Variation Two
instructions: Lay flat on the floor with your arms at either side.\
With one leg, hook one foot under the joint of your other leg.\
Rotate your hips so that your knees are pointing sideways, keeping your hooked leg flat against the floor.\
Pause at the apex of the stretch and repeat with your other leg.\

exercises.title: Lower back Stretch Variation One
instructions: Sit on the floor with the tops of your feet pointed and flat on the ground. Move your arms out in front of you in the diving position, placing your palms flat against the ground.\
With your arms fully extended, rest your buttocks on the heels of your feet, you can crawl your hands forward to extend the stretch if need be.\
Hold the extended position for a few seconds, and return to starting position.\

exercises.title: Cable Goblet Squat
instructions: Start with a straight bar or easy bar attachment .\
Get your elbows directly underneath the bar, squat straight up and then walk back a few steps.\
Break at your knees and hips to initiate the squat. Make sure you maintain a flat back.\
Squat all the way back to a standing position.\

exercises.title: Cable Bar Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Start with a straight bar or ez bar attachment set to the bottom of the machine. Squat the weight up into a standing position and walk a few steps back\
Push your butt back to initiate the movement and then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position.\
To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back on any exercise.\

exercises.title: Cable Single Leg Deadlift
instructions: Start with a straight bar or easy bar attachment. Squat the weight up into a standing position and walk a few steps back.\
Push your butt back to initiate the movement while lifting one of your legs.\r\ Then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position.\
Compete your given amount of reps, then switch to opposite leg.\
To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back.\

exercises.title: Cable Pull Through
instructions: This exercise works best with a rope attachment but can be done with anything. The attachment should be set to the bottom of the machine.\
Face away from the cable machine, straddle the cable itself, and grab the attachment.\r\ Walk a few steps away.\
Break at the hips while maintaining a flat back and mostly extended knees.\
Push hips forward until you are back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Cable Standing Straight Leg Glute Kickback
instructions: Use an ankle attachment. The cable should be set to the bottom of the crossover machine.\
Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes.\
Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.\

exercises.title: Cable Zercher Squat
instructions: Start with a straight bar or easy bar attachment .\
Place the bar in your elbows, squat straight up and then walk back a few steps.\
Break at your knees and hips to initiate the squat. Make sure you maintain a flat back.\
Squat all the way back to a standing position.\

exercises.title: Cable Incline Bench Straight Leg Kickback
instructions: Use an ankle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. Put the bench at incline level. The cable should be set to shoulder height.\
Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes.\
Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.\

exercises.title: Cable Bench Straight Leg Kickback
instructions: Use an ankle attachment. Bring a bench over to the cables. The cable should be set to hip height.\
Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes.\
Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.\

exercises.title: Cable Standing Mid Kickback
instructions: Use an ankle attachment. The cable should be set halfway up the crossover machine.\
Start with a bent knee position. Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes.\
Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.\

exercises.title: Cable Standing Straight Leg Mid Kickback
instructions: Use an ankle attachment. The cable should be set to halfway up the crossover machine.\
Push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes.\
Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.\

exercises.title: Cable Zercher Good Morning
instructions: Begin by standing with your feet about hip-width apart and holding the bar in the crook of your elbows, with your palms facing towards your body.\
Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, bend at the hips and lower your torso forward until it is nearly parallel to the ground.\
Push through your heels to extend your hips and raise your body back to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Cable Bar Staggered Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Start with a straight bar attachment set to the bottom of the machine. Squat the weight up into a standing position and walk a few steps back.\
Stand with a staggered stance. Push your butt back to initiate the movement and then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position.\
To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back on any exercise.\

exercises.title: Cable Elevated Deadlift
instructions: Start with handles set to the bottom of the machine. Grab a box, stand on top of the box, squat the weight up into a standing position.\
Push your butt back to initiate the movement and then push your butt forward until you're back in a standing position.\
To protect yourself from injury, always maintain a flat back on any exercise.\

exercises.title: Band Good Morning
instructions: Anchor the band at hip level. Take a few steps away until the band is taut.\
Push your hips back while keeping your back flat until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.\

exercises.title: Band Pullthrough
instructions: Anchor the band to the lowest point possible. Straddle the band and then grab with both hands.\
Take a few steps away until the band is taut.\
Push your butt back until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings. Then extend the hips back into the starting position.\

exercises.title: Band Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Stand on your band with both feet.\
Hinge forward at the hips while keeping a flat back.\
Hinge until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings.\
Push your hips back forward until you are in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Plate Deadlift
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate in front of the feet, and the knees slightly bent.\
Bend the hips and knees to grip the plate with palms facing the body.\
Keeping the back straight, stand up while lifting the plate off the ground.\
Return the plate back to the starting position by bending the hips and knees, keeping control of the plate.\

exercises.title: Plate Single Leg Pinch Grip Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and facing forwards. Grip the sides of a weight plate with your palms facing down.\
Balance on one foot, as you raise the weight keep your arms and back straight, while you bring your  other foot back towards the ground\
Keep four raised leg straight and in alignment with your back as you lower the plate back down to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Plate Good Morning Anterior
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate held in front of you, and the knees slightly bent.\
Bend forward at the hips, keeping the back straight, until the torso is parallel to the floor.\
Push through the hips to return to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Plate Good Morning
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, the plate held behind the neck and the knees slightly bent.\
Bend forward at the hips, keeping the back straight, until the torso is parallel to the floor.\
Push through the hips to return to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Plate Single Leg Deadlift
instructions: Engage your core and straighten your legs to lift the plate off the ground.\
Stand on one leg, keeping the other leg off the ground, while holding the plate in front of your body.\
Keep your back straight and maintain a neutral head position while looking straight ahead.\
Lower the plate back down to the ground while keeping your balance on one leg.\

exercises.title: Plate Pinch Grip Deadlift
instructions: Stand facing the plate with your feet shoulder-width apart and the plate positioned between your feet.\
Bend down and grasp the plate from the top edges with both hands, making sure your thumbs and fingers are evenly spaced.\
Keep your back straight, chest up and core engaged, and stand up with the plate, keeping it close to your body.\
Lower the plate back down to the ground, keeping control and maintaining good posture.\

exercises.title: Plate Staggered Deadlift
instructions: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding a weight plate.\
Place one foot slightly behind the other, with the heel of your back foot elevated.\
From this starting position, bend at the hips and knees to lower the plate towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.\
Once the plate is below your knees, drive through your heels to stand back up to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Plate Staggered Pinch Grip Deadlift
instructions: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and holding two plates with a pinch grip.\
Place one foot slightly behind the other, with the heel of your back foot elevated.\
From this starting position, bend at the hips and knees to lower the plates towards the ground, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.\

exercises.title: Plate Superman
instructions: Lay flat on the ground on your stomach with your arms extended overhead. Hold a plate with a neutral grip.\
Lift your legs and chest off the ground simultaneously and hold for a 1 count at the top.\
Relax your lower back and lower your legs and chest back to the floor.\

exercises.title: Plate Superman Hold
instructions: Hold a plate in both hands.\
Pull your arms and legs off the ground while and hold that position.\

exercises.title: Plate Staggered Waiters Bow
instructions: Set up a bar at mid way up your quad. Place the working leg against the bar.\
Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.\
Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Plate Waiters Bow
instructions: Place a barbell at about midway up your thigh. Press your quads into the barbell. Hold a plate up to your chest.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: TRX Ab Rollout
instructions: Grasp the TRX handles with both hands, keeping your arms extended and your shoulders away from your ears.\
Keep your abs engaged, roll forward onto your toes, and extend your arms in front of you.\
Slowly lower your body down to the ground, keeping your arms straight and your abs engaged.\
When your head gets between your arms, pause for a moment and then use your abs to pull your body back up to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Happy Baby
instructions: Lie down on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.\
Lift your feet off the floor and bring your knees towards your chest.\
Reach inside your knees and hold onto the outside edges of your feet.\
Gently pull your knees towards your armpits and rock side to side for a few breaths.\

exercises.title: Sphinx Pose
instructions: Start by lying down on your stomach on a yoga mat or a comfortable surface.\
Place your elbows underneath your shoulders, keeping your forearms parallel to each other.\
Press your palms and forearms firmly into the ground to lift your chest up, while keeping your hips and legs relaxed.\
Make sure your shoulders are relaxed and away from your ears. Gently roll your shoulder blades down and back to open up your chest.\
Lengthen your spine by lifting the crown of your head towards the ceiling, while keeping your chin tucked in slightly.\

exercises.title: Cobra Pose
instructions: Start prone, hands under shoulders.\
Inhale, lift chest, arch back.\
Elongate neck, gaze up. Breathe, hold. Release, exhale.\

exercises.title: Bosu Ball Single Leg Hip Thrust
instructions: Sit on Bosu, lean back, one foot on the floor.\
Drive hips upward, squeezing glutes, one leg extended.\
Lower hips back down and switch legs.\

exercises.title: Bosu Ball Superman
instructions: Lie face down on Bosu, arms extended.\
Lift arms, chest, and legs off the Bosu.\
Hold for a moment, then lower back down.\

exercises.title: Vitruvian Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Take an overhand grip.\
Keep your knees mostly extended and hinge forward at the hips.\

exercises.title: Vitruvian Single Leg Deadlift
instructions: Hold medicine ball while standing on one leg.\
Hinge forward on one leg, extending other leg behind.\
Return to starting position. Repeat on other leg.\

exercises.title: Vitruvian Staggered Deadlift
instructions: Place one foot firmly on the ground and one foot behind the other. Bend the knee on your back leg.\
Hinge forward until you feel a stretch in your front leg.\

exercises.title: Smith Machine Sumo Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Stance width can vary with a sumo DL. Some prefer toes near the plates. Others prefer a more narrow stance to get more drive off the floor.\
Make sure your arms are inside your legs. The bar should be just over your mid-foot. Flatten your back and unrack the bar\
Leave your knees mostly extended and flex and extend your hips.\

exercises.title: Smith Machine Staggered Deadlift
instructions: Place one foot behind. You should only be on your toes on that back foot. Your front foot should be planted flat the entire time.\
Bend your back knee and push your hips back. Look for a stretch in your front hamstring.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward again until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Smith Machine Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Take a shoulder width, double overhand or mixed grip.\
Push your hips back while leaving your knees mostly extended. Look for a stretch in your hamstrings.\
When you feel the stretch, push your hips forward until you're back in a standing position.\

exercises.title: Alternating Swipe Around
instructions: Lie on your front, arms above head. Squeeze glutes to protect lower back\
Raise your chest and arms off the ground. Adduct (bring your arms by your hips) in an alternating fashion.\
You can touch down and repeat the whole movement, or remain off the ground and just perform the \\

exercises.title: Swipe Around
instructions: Lie on your front, arms above head. Squeeze glutes to protect lower back\
Raise your chest and arms off the ground. Adduct (bring your arms by your hips)\
You can touch down and repeat the whole movement, or remain off the ground and just perform the \\

exercises.title: Skydiver
instructions: Lie on your front with your arms by your side, palms facing down.\
Tense your back muscles to raise both ends of your body off the ground.\
Keep your core engaged as you will be supporting your weight on your belly.\

exercises.title: Box Supported Single Leg Deadlift
instructions: Place a box behind you and one foot on it. Keep your chest up and the back straight\
Tilt at the hips to perform a deadlift. Use the box for balance and support\
Make sure you straighten your back leg when performing the deadlift.\
As you get comfortable with the movement, try to lift the leg off the box when you reach the end range of the deadlift.\

exercises.title: QL Mobilisation Floor Foam Roller
instructions: Lie on the floor keeping your knees bent and the feet on the floor.\
Place a massage ball under your lower back and move around till the ball presses into a tight/sore spot.\
If you use a foam roller you would have to be seated and leaning back into the roller.\

exercises.title: Prayer Stretch 2 Roller
instructions: Sit on your heels and reach out your arms on a box or foam roller while pressing the chest towards the ground.\

exercises.title: Prayer Stretch 1
instructions: Sit on your heels and reach out your arms on the floor while pressing the chest towards the ground.\

exercises.title: Deadlift Bounces Stretch
instructions: Stand up straight with a good form.\
Send your hips back and start tilting the upper body.\
Maintain a straight back as you aim for your toes.\
Your range depends on your hamstring flexibility.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Deadlift
instructions: Stand up straight with a good form.\
Send your hips back and start tilting the upper body.\
Maintain a straight back as you aim for your toes.\
Lower the bar to the floor by bending your knees and keeping your back straight.\

exercises.title: Lumbar Rotation 5
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground.\
Drop your knees towards one side and add a kick at the end of range.\
To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.\

exercises.title: Lumbar Rotation 3
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground.\
Drop your knees towards one side then place your ankle on the opposite knee.\
To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.\

exercises.title: Lumbar Rotation 4
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground.\
Cross your legs. Drop your knees towards one side before moving towards the other.\
To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.\

exercises.title: Lumbar Rotation 2
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground.\
Drop your knees towards one side before moving towards the other.\
To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.\

exercises.title: Lumbar Rotation 1
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and the feet flat on the ground.\
Keep your knees and ankles together. Drop both knees towards the same side.\
Stay in this position and breathe deep and slow.\
To increase the intensity of the stretch you can reach up with your arms.\

exercises.title: Cobra Stretch 2
instructions: Lay on your front placing your palms under your shoulders\
Keep the elbows bent and close to your body\
Lift your upper body off the ground supporting your weight on your palms\
Keep the hips on the ground\

exercises.title: Cobra Stretch 1
instructions: Lay on your front placing your palms under your shoulders\
Keep the elbows bent and close to your body\
Lift your upper body off the ground supporting your weight on your forearms\
Keep the hips on the ground\

exercises.title: Floor Knee Pull Bilateral
instructions: Lie on your back with bent knees.\
Hug your knees and pull them towards your chest.\
Feel your lower back come off the ground.\
You can add a you can add an abduction to target the hips as well.\

exercises.title: Lumbar Extensor Mobilisation Supine Bent Knees Peanut Tool
instructions: Lie on your back with your feet on a bench. Place a peanut tool under your lower back.\
Adjust pressure by pressing your heels into the bench. Roll back and forth or side to side\
Maintain a neutral lower back (do not tilt the pelvis).\

exercises.title: Lower Back Extensions 4
instructions: Lie on your front and bring your arms in the \\
Squeeze your glutes and tilt your hips backwards (flattens the front of your hips against the ground).\
Raise your chest off the ground and lower it without resting on the ground before the next rep.\

exercises.title: Lower Back Extensions 3
instructions: Lie on your front and bring your arms into the \\
Squeeze your glutes and tilt your hips backwards (flattens the front of your hips against the ground).\
Raise your chest off the ground and lower it without resting on the ground before the next rep.\

exercises.title: Lower Back Extensions 2
instructions: Lie on your front leaning your forehead on the back of your palms.\
Squeeze your glutes and tilt your hips backwards (flattens the front of your hips against the ground).\
Raise your chest off the ground and lower it without resting on the ground before the next rep\

exercises.title: Partner Lower Back Extensions
instructions: Lie on your front leaning your forehead on the back of your palms.\
Ask someone to hold your ankles or secure them under a supportive structure.\
Squeeze your glutes and tilt your hips backwards (flattens the front of your hips against the ground).\
Raise your chest off the ground and lower it without resting on the ground before the next rep.\

exercises.title: Knee Pull And Lumbar Rotation
instructions: Lie on your back and flatten you lower back against the ground\
Pull one knee towards your chest and then across your body till it forces your lower back into a rotated position.\

exercises.title: I Into W
instructions: Lie on your front with your arms extended and above your head.\
Point the thumbs up. Try to raise your arms off the ground keeping them straight.\
Bend your elbows to the side and form the letter \\
position but do not rest on the ground\

exercises.title: Inchworm
instructions: Stand tall, hinge at hips, and reach hands to the floor.\
Walk hands forward into a plank position.\
Walk feet towards hands and repeat the motion.\

exercises.title: Barbell Front Squat Olympic

male.side: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Front Squat Olympic - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Front Squat Olympic - Female-front.mp4

instructions: Measure your hands by the markings on the bar to make sure you're even. Then throw your elbows underneath the bar.\
The bar should be set so high on your shoulders it digs into your neck a bit. Make sure to push your elbows up to the ceiling for the entire rep. To make sure you don't get too pitched forward.\
Use the squat stance you would use for a back or goblet squat. Push your hips back to initiate the squat. Break at the knees until you hit parallel depth.\
Squat back up to a standing position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Situp
