male.side: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Situp - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Situp - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Situp - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Hold the bar with a slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Push the bar up toward the ceiling and maintain that elbow extension.\
Flex your abs and sit-up. Aim to get your torso vertical while maintaining the barbell overhead.\

exercises.title: Barbell Hooklying Bench Press

male.front: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Hooklying Bench Press - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Hooklying Bench Press - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Hooklying Bench Press - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Hooklying Bench Press - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Start in a bench press position with your feet planted on the bench and knees bent.\
Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, positioning your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.\
Lift the barbell off the rack and lower it to your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides.\
Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.\

exercises.title: Barbell Larsen Bench Press

male.side: videos/Abdominals - Barbell Larsen Bench Press - Male-side.mp4

instructions: Start in a bench press position with your legs elevated. Try to keep your knees with a slight bend in them.\
Unrack the bar then initiate the rep.\
Bring the bar to your torso and tap your ribcage before pressing back to the ceiling.\

exercises.title: Landmine Hollow Hold

male.front: videos/Abdominals - Landmine Hollow Hold - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Abdominals - Landmine Hollow Hold - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Abdominals - Landmine Hollow Hold - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Abdominals - Landmine Hollow Hold - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Start by lying flat on your back with your legs extended towards the landmine attachment and your arms overhead, holding the landmine barbell with both hands while engaging your core muscles by pressing your lower back into the ground and drawing your belly button in towards your spine.\
Lift your legs off the ground, keeping them together and straight, and simultaneously raise your upper body off the ground, reaching the landmine barbell away from your face.\
Hold this position for the desired duration, then carefully lower the barbell to the ground.\

exercises.title: Landmine Sit Up

Raise your back off the ground until you are sitting at a 90 degree angle.\
Then lower slowly back to the floor.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Situp

male.side: videos/Abdominals - Dumbbell Situp - Male-side.mp4

Sit-up by flexing your abs. Continue to reach for the ceiling for the entire rep.\

Your feet should be hovering off the ground. (If that's too hard start with heels on the floor)\
Rotate your upper spine to engage your obliques.\

Start with the DB by your right hand. Reach with your left and pull the dumbbell to your left arm. Then repeat with the right.\

Pull your upper back and legs off the ground. Make a banana shape with your body.\
The dumbbell should be held in your hands and your ears should be between your biceps.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Renegade Row

male.front: videos/Abdominals - Dumbbell Renegade Row - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Abdominals - Dumbbell Renegade Row - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Abdominals - Dumbbell Renegade Row - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Abdominals - Dumbbell Renegade Row - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Start by getting into a plank position with a dumbbell in each hand. Your feet should be shoulder-width apart and your hands should be placed on the dumbbells, with your palms facing each other.\
From this starting position, row one dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and your core engaged.\
Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position, and repeat on the other side.\
Make sure to keep your body straight and your hips level throughout the movement.\

exercises.title: Dumbbell Crunch

male.side: videos/Abdominals - Dumbbell Crunch - Male-side.mp4

Hold a dumbbell over your clavicle.\
Engage your core muscles and lift your torso off the floor until your shoulders are a few inches off the ground.\
Lower yourself back down to the starting position, but avoid resting completely on the floor between reps.\

exercises.title: Plank IYTW

male.side: videos/Abdominals - Plank IYTW - Male-side.mp4

instructions: Start in a plank position. Hold one dumbbell.\
Raise the dumbbell straight out in front of you (I), at a 45 degree angle (Y), out to the side (T), and then bend at the elbow while raising (W).\
Going through IYTW counts as one rep.\
Make sure to keep your hips stable. If you're unable to, try performing this exercise from the knees.\

exercises.title: Pushup to Renegade Row
instructions: Start in a high plank position with a pair of dumbbells positioned under your shoulders. Your hands should grip the dumbbells, palms facing each other.\
Keep your core engaged and your back straight as you row one dumbbell up towards your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body.\
Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position and repeat on the other side.\

Reach for your feet with the dumbbell before bringing your spine back to the floor.\

exercises.title: Crunches
instructions: Lay flat on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground, about a foot from your lower back.\
Place your fingertips on your temples with your palms facing out.\
Draw your belly into the base of your spine to engage the muscles, then raise your head and shoulders off the floor. Return to starting position and repeat.\

Keep your legs together and as straight as possible.\
Slowly raise your legs to a 90 angle, pause at this position, or as high as you can reach your legs, and then slowly lower your legs back down.\
Duration of these movements should be slow so that you do not utilize momentum, enabling you to get the most out of the exercise.\

instructions: Start standing with your feet hip-width apart. Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you.\
Quickly jump your feet back into a plank position, keeping your body in a straight line from your head to your toes.\
Perform a push-up, keeping your core tight and your elbows close to your body.\
Jump your feet back towards your hands, and then jump up into the air, reaching your arms overhead.\
Land softly and immediately lower your body back into the squat position to repeat the movement.\

instructions: Start by standing upright with your feet shoulder-width apart. Hold a single weight plate overhead with both hands, keeping your arms extended straight above your head.\
Begin walking forward, taking slow and steady steps while maintaining a straight line. Your focus should be on maintaining balance and control of the weight plate overhead.\

As you walk, continue to keep your arms extended and the weight plate overhead. Try to maintain good posture and avoid leaning forward or backward, as this could result in losing control of the weight plate.\
Continue walking for a set distance or for a certain amount of time, keeping your focus on proper form and technique. When finished, return to the starting position and repeat as desired.\

exercises.title: Table Top Pose Variation 1
instructions: Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.\
Turn your hands so that your fingers are pointing towards the sides of your mat and the tops of your hands are on the floor.\
Keep your arms straight and your shoulders away from your ears.\
Hold the pose for several breaths or as long as is comfortable.\

exercises.title: Table Top Pose Variation 2
instructions: Start in a tabletop position on your hands and knees with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.\
Turn your hands so that your fingers are pointing towards your knees and the tops of your hands are on the floor.\
Keep your arms straight and your shoulders away from your ears.\
Hold the pose for several breaths or as long as is comfortable.\

exercises.title: Table Top Pose Variation 3
instructions: Come onto your hands and knees on the mat with your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees under your hips.\
Turn your palms down and spread your fingers wide, with your fingertips pointing towards your knees.\
Press into your palms and extend your arms fully to lift your shoulders away from your ears.\
Hold the pose for a few breaths, and then release by slowly lowering your hands to the mat and coming back to a neutral tabletop position.\

Bend forward at your hips and keep your knees as fully extended as possible.\
Grab the barbell and then extend your hips while maintaining a straight back.\
From the standing position, lower the weight in a controlled manner.\
You can either lower the weight to the floor or before you touch the floor, depending on your mobility.\

instructions: Sit on the ground with a bench behind you. Have the barbell over your legs just above your hips.\
Lean back against the bench so that your shoulders are resting upon it, stretch your arms out to either side using the bench as support.\
Raise the weight by driving through your feet and extending your hips upwards. Support the weight with your shoulders and feet.\
Slowly extend as far as you can, and then slowly return to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Barbell Deadlift
instructions: Stand with your mid-foot under the bar and grip the bar with your hands, about a shoulder width apart.\
Bend your knees, then lift the bar by straightening your back. It is important to keep your back straight.\
Stand to your full height and hold.\
Lower the bar to the floor by bending your knees and keeping your back straight.\

instructions: Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. (The lower the box is the lower the mobility requirement).\
You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously.\
Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower.\
The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.\

instructions: Measure your shoulders against the bar to make sure you're even. Throw your shoulders under the bar. The bar should be digging into your neck slightly.\
Make sure to push your elbows up to the ceiling for the entire rep. To make sure you don't get too pitched forward.\
Use the squat stance you would use for a back or goblet squat. Push your hips back to initiate the squat. Break at the knees until you hit parallel depth.\
Squat back up to a standing position.\

Push your hips back and break at the knees. Push your elbows forward to keep yourself from getting pitched too far forward.\
Aim to get your hamstrings to parallel with the floor.\
Push your heels into the floor and squat back to a standing position.\

Drive through your front heel as you step back to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.\

Follow the movement path as you bring your knee back down to the ground beneath your hip, keeping your knee bent to maintain control of the barbell.\

Squat down with control while keeping the weight of the barbell as close to centered over your midpoint as possible, then drive through your heels to stand all the way back up and return to starting position.\
Repeat for desired number of reps, then switch the side of your body the barbell is on every subsequent set.\

instructions: Stand facing the landmine with your feet shoulder width apart while holding the end of the barbell in your hands with your arms fully extended down towards the ground.\
While keeping your torso tall and core engaged, step directly out to one side, using the foot you have stepped out with to sit down into the lunge while keeping your other leg straight.\
Drive through your heel on your bent leg as your step together to return to the starting position.\
Repeat for desired number of reps on the same side before switching sides.\

instructions: Stand in front of the landmine with your feet hip-width apart and your back straight. Grasp the landmine barbell with one hand, holding it at at your side with your palm facing in towards your leg.\

Take a step backward with your foot on the same side that you're holding the barbell, lowering your body into a lunge position. Bend both knees to lower your body down until your front thigh is parallel to the ground, or as low as your flexibility allows. Keep your torso upright, your chest lifted, and your core engaged throughout the movement.\
Push through the heel of your front foot to return to the starting position. Repeat for desired number of reps before switching sides.\

instructions: Stand facing the landmine attachment while holding the end of the bar with one hand at your shoulder on the same side with your elbow tucked to your body underneath your wrist.\

Step back with the leg on the same side that you are holding the bar on and with control lower yourself down into a lunge position while keeping your core engaged and torso tall, then drive through your front heel as you step back to the starting position.\
Once your feet are back in the starting position, drive the bar up overhead until your arm is fully extended, then lower the bar back down to the starting position.\
Repeated for the desired number of reps, then switch sides.\

instructions: Stand perpendicularly to the barbell with the end of the bar in front of your feet. Squat down and hold the end of the bar with your hand closer to the landmine attachment with your palm facing your body.\

Drive your feet into the ground to start the motion. As your legs fully extend, pull the bar upwards with your hand and start to rotate your torso in towards the landmine attachment. As you do so, bring your other hand up to the bar and switch your grip. Press through the bar to extend your arm all the way upright, pivoting your back foot to allow for more trunk rotation.\
Perform the movement in reverse to return to the starting position. Repeat for desired number of reps before switching sides.\

instructions: Find a box or bench that is roughly knee height or a few inches lower. (The lower the box is the lower the mobility requirement).\
You can either place your toes or the top of your foot on the box. Point your front foot forward or slightly turned outwards and break at the knees and hips simultaneously.\
Aim to get your front leg to hit parallel depth (hamstring parallel with the ground) or lower.\
The further forward your front foot is, the longer the Range of Motion is at your hips. The further back your front foot is, the longer the ROM at your knees.\

instructions: Step forward with one leg and lower your body until your front thigh is parallel to the floor and your back knee almost touches the ground. Keep your chest up and your front foot flat on the floor.\
Push through your front foot to straighten your legs and return to the starting position.\
Repeat the movement with your other leg.\

instructions: Engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine. This will help to stabilize your body.\
Take a large step to the side with your right foot, planting it firmly on the ground.\
As you step, bend your right knee and lower your hips until your right thigh is parallel to the ground. Your left leg should remain straight.\
Push through your right heel to return to the starting position. Repeat on the opposite side by stepping out with your left foot.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Step Up Knee Drive
instructions: Begin by standing in front of a sturdy box or bench that is about knee-height.\
Place your right foot on the box and push through the heel to lift your body up and onto the box, bring your off leg all the way through until your leg is parallel with the ground.\
Step back down with your right foot, lowering your left foot to the ground.\

exercises.title: Hamstring Bridge With Elevated Legs Box Unilateral
instructions: Lie on your back. Place one heel on a box or bench, having a 90 angle at hip and knee.\
Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground).\
Push through your heel into the box, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.\

exercises.title: Hamstring Bridge With Elevated Legs Box Bilateral
instructions: Lie on your back. Place your heels on a box or bench, having a 90 angle at hips and knees.\
Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground).\
Push through your heels into the box, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.\

exercises.title: Hamstring Bridge Isometric Open Angle
instructions: Lie on your back with knees slightly bent and heels dug in.\
Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back on the ground).\
Press the heels into the ground to raise your hips off it.\
Hold the position for the specified duration.\

exercises.title: Glute Bridge Isometric Hold Single Alternate
instructions: Lie on your back. Bend your knees so your feet are flat on the floor with heels under knees\
Push through your heels into the ground, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees. Squeeze your bum at the top of the movement\
Maintain the top position and extend one leg at the time.\

exercises.title: Glute Bridge Eccentric Unilateral
instructions: Lie down with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor.\
Push your hips up so that your butt is elevated and your back straight.\
Tense your glutes and raise your hips towards the ceiling.\
Once you are at the highest point you can manage, hold the position for a few seconds, and raise one leg off the ground.\
Lower slowly to the start position.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Alternating Forward Lunge
instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.\
Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.\
Push off your right foot to return to the starting position. Then switch legs.\

exercises.title: Walking Lunge
instructions: Take a step forward shifting your weight onto the front leg.\
Bend the knee of the front leg so the knee of the back leg comes close to the ground.\
Stand up and go into lunging with the opposite leg.\

male.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Single Leg Glute Bridge - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Single Leg Glute Bridge - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Single Leg Glute Bridge - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Laying on the floor with one knee bent with the foot firmly on the floor and one leg extended, rest the kettlebell on your pelvis.\
Pushing through the bent leg and keeping the core muscles engaged, raise your pelvis and the extended leg off the floor until your stomach, pelvis and thighs make a straight line.\
Slowly lower to the ground to the starting position and repeat.\

female.front: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Hip Thrust - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Hip Thrust - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Sitting on the floor with your knees bent and feet planted firmly on the floor, lean your back against the bench.\
Resting the kettlebell on your pelvis, raise your pelvis until your stomach, pelvis and thighs are in line.\
Slowly lower until you are in the starting position and repeat.\

instructions: Sitting on the floor with one knee bent with the foot firmly on the floor and one leg extended, lean your back against the bench.\
Resting the kettlebell on your pelvis, raise your pelvis until your stomach, pelvis and thighs are in line.\
Slowly lower until you are in the starting position and repeat.\

instructions: Standing up straight, using a bench as a step, raise one foot onto the bench and hold the kettlebell in the same arm as the straight leg.\
Stand and bring both feet onto the bench. Slowly lower your leg back down to the starting position.\

instructions: Hold the weight tucked into your upper chest area, keeping your elbows in. Your feet should be slightly wider than your shoulders.\
Sink down into the squat, keeping your elbows inside the track of your knees.\
Push through your heels while keeping your chest up and return to the starting position.\

Sink down into the squat, keeping your elbows inside the track of your knees.\
Push through your heels while keeping your chest up and return to the starting position.\

instructions: Stand straight with your feet slightly apart and hold a kettlebell in one hand.\
Bring the same leg as the arm holding the kettlebell behind you, squat down until your back knee touches the ground, keeping your back straight.\
Return to the starting position and repeat.\

Bring the same leg as the arm holding the kettlebell in front of you, squat down until your thigh is parallel to the ground, keeping your back straight.\
Return to the starting position and repeat.\

Swing kettlebells up to shoulder.\

instructions: Begin with a two kettlebells between your legs, hinge at hips, then swing it upwards explosively.\
As they rise, lock out arm overhead, wrist straight.\
Control the descent, then repeat.\

Lift hips, form figure four leg shape.\

Step forward, lunge, and return.\
Repeat with opposite leg.\

Step back down with your right foot, lowering your left foot to the ground.\

Lower into a squat, keeping weight on front heel.\

instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width. Kettlebell at your side.\
Step forward with your right foot and bend both knees to lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.\
Push off your right foot to return to the starting position.\
Step back with the same leg until the back knee taps the floor.\

instructions: Hold a kettlebell at your chest, feet hip-width apart.\
Step one leg diagonally back into a lunge.\
Alternate legs, keeping your chest up and core engaged.\

male.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Alternating Lateral Lunge - Male-side.mp4

Step out to one side, bending the knee.\

female.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Alternating Reverse Lunge - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Hold two kettlebells by your side.\
Take a big step backwards with your left leg, lowering your body until your left thigh is parallel to the ground and your right knee is bent at a 90-degree angle.\
Push back up and switch legs, alternating each rep.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Alternating Forward Lunge

male.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Alternating Forward Lunge - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Alternating Forward Lunge - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Alternating Forward Lunge - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Stand tall, holding kettlebells by your sides, feet hip-width apart.\
Step forward with one leg, lowering until both knees form 90 angles.\
Push through front foot, return to start, and switch legs.\

male.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Assisted Bulgarian Split Squat - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Assisted Bulgarian Split Squat - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Assisted Bulgarian Split Squat - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Grab a stick of some sort or hold onto something stable (rack, bench).\
Grab a box that is knee height or slightly lower.\
Hold the stick in your right arm, kettlebell in the other and put your right leg on the box.\
Begin your squat by breaking at the knees. Get your knee close to the floor or all the way to the floor. Make sure to keep your chest tall.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Front Rack Deficit Reverse Lunge

male.front: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Front Rack Deficit Reverse Lunge - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Front Rack Deficit Reverse Lunge - Male-side.mp4

female.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Front Rack Deficit Reverse Lunge - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Stand on a platform, kettlebells in front rack position, feet hip-width apart.\
Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged.\
Push through front foot, return to start.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Deficit Reverse Lunge

male.front: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Deficit Reverse Lunge - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Deficit Reverse Lunge - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Deficit Reverse Lunge - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Deficit Reverse Lunge - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Stand on a platform, kettlebells in each hand, feet hip-width apart.\
Step back, lowering knee toward floor, keeping chest upright and core engaged.\
Push through front foot, return to start.\

exercises.title: Kettlebell Quad Stomp

male.front: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Quad Stomp - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Quad Stomp - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Quad Stomp - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Kettlebell Quad Stomp - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Place your foot on a plate or a low box. Hold two kettlebells in each hand.\
Put all of your weight on your front foot and lean forward.\
Lower until your calves touch your hamstrings and then extend back up.\

exercises.title: Glutes Stretch Variation Three

male.front: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation Three - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation Three - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation Three - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation Three - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Lay flat and bring your left leg to 90 degrees.\
Hold your left leg with both hands and slowly rotate your hips to the right hand side.\
Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position.\
Switch sides and repeat.\

exercises.title: Glutes Stretch Variation Two

male.front: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation Two - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation Two - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation Two - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation Two - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Sit on the ground and lay one leg flat and the other over the top.\
Hold your leg with the same side arm and slowly rotate your hips and back.\
Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position.\
Switch sides and repeat.\

exercises.title: Glutes Stretch Variation One

male.front: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation One - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation One - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation One - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Glutes Stretch Variation One - Female-side.mp4

instructions: On your front, place one leg forward and then stretch out the same side arm across the mat/floor.\
Fully extend your leg and arm.\
Hold at the peak of the stretch, then slowly return to starting position.\
Switch sides and repeat.\

exercises.title: Cable Split Squat

male.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Split Squat - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Split Squat - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Split Squat - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Split Squat - Female-side.mp4

instructions: You can use a straight or EZ bar on this exercise. Cable should be set all to the bottom.\
Grab the attachment and walk back a few steps. Take a split stance. One leg in front and one behind.\
Break at the knees and hips to initiate the split squat. Make sure your back knee touches the floor.\
Squat back up into a standing position.\

exercises.title: Cable Standing Hip Abduction
instructions: Use an ankle attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the bottom.\
Face sideways with the ankle attachment on your outside leg. Walk a few steps away.\
Abduct at the hips and raise your leg out to the side.\
Return to the starting position and stop just short of your foot touching back to the ground (to keep tension on the muscle).\

exercises.title: Cable Quadruped Hip Abduction

male.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Quadruped Hip Abduction - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Quadruped Hip Abduction - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Quadruped Hip Abduction - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Quadruped Hip Abduction - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Use an ankle attachment. Cable should be set all the way to the bottom.\
Take a quadruped position with the cable going across your planted leg.\
Abduct at the hips and raise your leg out to the side.\
Return to the starting position and stop just short of the cables touching back down (to keep tension on the muscle).\

exercises.title: Cable Standing Hip Adduction

male.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Standing Hip Adduction - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Standing Hip Adduction - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Standing Hip Adduction - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Standing Hip Adduction - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Bring the cable all the way to the bottom of the stack. Use an ankle attachment.\
Keeping your feet together, move your legs out to the sides and then back to the midline of your body. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.\

exercises.title: Cable Standing Glute Kickback
instructions: Use an ankle attachment. The cable should be set to the bottom of the crossover machine.\
Break at the knee, push your ankle straight back, extending at the hip. Hold for a one count when you feel a contraction in your glutes.\
Then flex at the hips until you are back into your original position.\

exercises.title: Cable Belt Split Squat

male.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Belt Split Squat - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Belt Split Squat - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Belt Split Squat - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Belt Split Squat - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Put on a dip belt and attach the strap/ chain to the cable's carabiner.\
Take a few steps back and take a split stance.\
Lower into a split squat, letting the weight pull you forward. As you squat back to the starting position push yourself backwards against the resistance.\

exercises.title: Cable Belt Squat

male.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Belt Squat - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Belt Squat - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Cable Belt Squat - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Cable Belt Squat - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Put on a dip belt. Attach the strap/chain to the cable's carabiner.\
Take a few steps back. Begin to squat by flexing at the knees and hips.\
Let the weight pull you forward as you squat. Then push your toes through the front of your shoes as you squat back to the start position.\

exercises.title: Band Spanish Squat

male.front: videos/Glutes - Band Spanish Squat - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Band Spanish Squat - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Band Spanish Squat - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Band Spanish Squat - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Anchor a band to a stable point.\
Place the loops of the band behind your knees.\
Perform a normal squat and extend your knees against the band at the top.\

exercises.title: Band Glute Kickback

male.front: videos/Glutes - Band Glute Kickback - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Band Glute Kickback - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Band Glute Kickback - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Band Glute Kickback - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Get into a quadruped position. Loop the band around both of your wrists and one of your feet.\
Extend your knee and hip straight back until you feel like contraction in the glutes.\
Flex at the knee until back in the starting position.\

exercises.title: Band Leg Press

male.front: videos/Glutes - Band Leg Press - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Band Leg Press - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Band Leg Press - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Band Leg Press - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Lay flat on the ground with your head by the anchor point of the band, which should be 6 to 12 inches above your head\
Place the band around your midfoot and extend at the knees and hip.\

exercises.title: Band Squat

male.front: videos/Glutes - Band Squat - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Band Squat - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Band Squat - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Band Squat - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Stand with a shoulder width grip. Both feet should be on the band with the band loops in each of your hand.\
Push your butt back and also break at the knees.\
Try to hit parallel depth (bottom of your leg should be parallel with the ground). If you can't tell your squat depth, then try squatting in front of a mirror and watch your form.\

exercises.title: Band Hip Abduction

male.front: videos/Glutes - Band Hip Abduction - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Band Hip Abduction - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Band Hip Abduction - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Band Hip Abduction - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Attach the band around your ankle. Stand with feet hip-width apart, feet facing forward, and hands on hips.\
Lift your right leg away from your body to the side, keeping your knee straight. This is your starting position.\

Maintaining proper form, move your right leg as far to the side as you can, keeping your left leg planted firmly on the ground. Hold for a second and then return your right leg to the starting position.\

exercises.title: Band Hip Adduction

male.front: videos/Glutes - Band Hip Adduction - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Band Hip Adduction - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Band Hip Adduction - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Band Hip Adduction - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Attach a band to a stable anchor point, such as a door handle or post.\
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and place the band around your ankles.\
Keeping your feet together, move your legs out to the sides and then back to the midline of your body. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.\

exercises.title: Banded Side Walks
instructions: Place a band either just below or above your knees.\
Get into a quarter squat position.\
Step side to side without letting there be any slack in the band to keep tension on the band.\

exercises.title: Band Goblet Squat

male.front: videos/Glutes - Band Goblet Squat - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Band Goblet Squat - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Band Goblet Squat - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Glutes - Band Goblet Squat - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Stand with a shoulder width grip. Both feet should be on the band with the band looped over both hands.\
Push your butt back and also break at the knees.\
Try to hit parallel depth (bottom of your leg should be parallel with the ground). If you can't tell your squat depth, then try squatting in front of a mirror and watch your form.\

exercises.title: Plate Squat

male.front: videos/Glutes - Plate Squat - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Glutes - Plate Squat - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Glutes - Plate Squat - Female-front.mp4

instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart. Maintain the natural arch in your back and put the bar on your back. Squeezing your shoulder blades and raise your chest.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Standing Hamstring Curl
instructions: Stand up straight using a balancing aid.\
Shift your weight on one leg.\
Bend and extend the non-weight bearing leg.\
Knees should remain aligned.\

exercises.title: Slider Hamstring Curl
instructions: Lie on your back with slightly bent knees and heels on sliders.\
Pull your heels towards your glutes to lift your hips off the ground.\
Extend knees to starting position, but do not rest hips on ground.\

exercises.title: Bodyweight Standing Hamstring Curl Isometric
instructions: Stand up straight using a balancing aid.\
Shift your weight on one leg.\
Bend the non-weight bearing leg and hold.\
Knees should remain aligned.\

exercises.title: Slider Hamstring Curl Eccentric
instructions: Bend your knees so your feet are flat on the floor with heels under knees and toes raised.\
Place sliders under your heels. Perform a posterior pelvic tilt (flatten your lower back against the ground).\
Push through your heels into the ground, lifting your hips up to the point where there is a straight line from your chest to your knees.\
Extend your legs in a slow, controlled manner, to lower your bum to the ground.\
Casually bend knees before repeating.\

instructions: Position yourself on a glute ham raise machine or find a suitable substitute like a stability ball or bench.\
Adjust the equipment to fit your body by setting the footplate at an appropriate height and making sure your feet are securely anchored.\
Begin the movement by slowly lowering your upper body towards the ground while keeping your torso and legs aligned.\
Once you reach the lowest point where your body is parallel to the ground or as far as you can comfortably go, pause briefly.\
Engage your glutes and hamstrings again as you push yourself back up to the starting position, using the strength of your posterior chain muscles.\

exercises.title: Child Pose Arms Extended
instructions: Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground.\
Sit back onto your heels and extend your arms out in front of you.\
Rest your forehead on the ground.\
Hold for a few breaths and then release.\

instructions: Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground.\
Sit back onto your heels and extend your arms out in front of you to one side.\
Rest your forehead on the ground.\
Hold for a few breaths and then repeat on the other side.\

exercises.title: Child Pose Arms On Side
instructions: Begin in a tabletop position with your hands and knees on the ground.\
Sit back onto your heels and place your arms at your sides with your palms facing up.\
Rest your forehead on the ground.\
Hold for a few breaths and then release.\

exercises.title: extended-side-angle-pose
instructions: Begin in a lunge position with your right foot forward and your left foot back.\
Place your right hand on a block or the ground on the outside of your right foot.\
Reach your left arm overhead and then round your spine, bringing your left hand to your right ear.\
Look down towards your right foot as you reach your left arm towards the front of the room, feeling a stretch in your side body. Hold for a few breaths and then switch sides.\

exercises.title: Extended side Angle Pose With Block
instructions: Begin in a lunge position with your right foot forward and your left foot back.\
Place a block on the outside of your right foot and place your right hand on top of it.\
Look down towards your right foot as you reach your left arm towards the front of the room, feeling a stretch in your side body. Hold for a few breaths and then switch sides.\

Repeat for desired number of reps, switching hands at the top of each rep.\

Press the barbell overhead by extending your arm fully, pushing the weight upward. Keep your core engaged, your back straight, and your shoulder down throughout the movement. Pause briefly at the top of the movement with your arm fully extended overhead. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position at shoulder height with control.\
Repeat for the desired number of reps on one side before switching sides.\

instructions: Start by setting up the rings to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them.\
Stand facing the rings grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders.\
Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line.\
Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.\

instructions: Start by setting up the TRX straps to a secure anchor point and adjust the straps so that they hang about waist height when you stand under them.\
Stand facing the TRX straps, grab the handles with both hands, and step forward so that your body is in a plank position with your hands directly beneath your shoulders.\
Lower your body down by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the handles. Keep your core tight and your body in a straight line.\
Push your body back up to the starting position, straightening your arms as you do so. Make sure to engage your chest, triceps, and core throughout the movement.\

Drive through your palm to extend your elbow and return the bar to the starting position, then repeat for the desired number of reps before switching sides.\

instructions: Starting lying on your back perpendicularly to the barbell while holding the end of the bar in your hand that is further away from the landmine attachment. Your elbow should be rest on the ground at a 45 to 60 degree angle from your torso, with your wrist stacked over your elbow.\
Drive the end of the bar upwards, squeezing your chest at the top of the movement. Lower the bar back down until your elbow gently touches the ground.\
Repeat for the desired number of reps on one side before switching sides.\

exercises.title: Thoracic Flexion And Extensions
instructions: Bring yourself on all 4's. Push the ground away from you, rounding back and shoulders as much as possible.\
To enhance the spine flexion suck the belly button in and tuck the tailbone (coccyx) under. Hold this position for a brief moment\
Now do the exact opposite, try to bend the spine backwards. Go back and forth on these positions\

exercises.title: Shoulder Flexion Thoracic Extensions
instructions: Place a tube roller or half tube on the ground parallel to your body.\
Lie on the tube making sure your whole back and neck are supported.\
Knees bent and on the ground, lower back flat on the tube and chin tucked in.\
Bring your arms by you hips and pull shoulders back.\
This is your starting position. Raise arms and drop them back towards the ground over your head\

exercises.title: Thoracic Extensions Foam Roller
instructions: Place a foam roller on the floor perpendicular to your body.\
Sit and lie back onto it aiming for your mid back to be in contact with the roller.\
Gently tilt your hips backward, squeeze glutes and engage core to protect the lower back.\
Support head on palms, elbows rotated in. Slightly lift hips off the ground.\

exercises.title: Scapular Elevation
instructions: From the standing or seated position straighten your back.\
Pull the shoulders back but keep them relaxed.\
Move shoulders towards from your ears and return to the starting, relaxed position.\

exercises.title: Scapular Depression
instructions: From the standing or seated position straighten your back.\
Pull the shoulders back but keep them relaxed.\
Move shoulders away from your ears and return to the starting, relaxed position.\

exercises.title: Landmine Kneeling Twist

male.front: videos/Obliques - Landmine Kneeling Twist - Male-front.mp4
male.side: videos/Obliques - Landmine Kneeling Twist - Male-side.mp4

female.front: videos/Obliques - Landmine Kneeling Twist - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Obliques - Landmine Kneeling Twist - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Kneel down facing the landmine with your knees hip-width apart and your back straight. Grasp the landmine barbell with both hands, interlacing your fingers and holding it above and slightly in front of your body.\

Keeping your core engaged and your back straight, twist your torso to one side, rotating your arms and the landmine along with it. Pause briefly at the end of the twist, feeling the contraction in your oblique muscles.\
Slowly rotate back to the starting position, then twist to the opposite side, repeating the same motion.\
Repeat both sides of the rotation for the desired number of reps.\

exercises.title: Landmine Oblique Twist

female.front: videos/Obliques - Landmine Oblique Twist - Female-front.mp4
female.side: videos/Obliques - Landmine Oblique Twist - Female-side.mp4

instructions: Stand facing the landmine, with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent. Grasp the landmine barbell with both hands, interlacing your fingers and holding it at chest height. Position your arms straight out in front of you, parallel to the floor, with your elbows slightly bent.\

While keeping your core engaged, rotate your torso and the landmine to one side. Twist through your waist, using your oblique muscles to generate the movement. Pivot on the ball of your opposite foot as you rotate away from it.\
Rotate back to the starting position, then perform the same movement in the opposite direction.\
Repeat for the desired number of reps.\

instructions: Start sitting on the ground facing the landmine attachment, holding the end of the bar in both hands slightly in front of and above your chest while holding your feet off the ground and knees bent.\

Bending your elbows as little as possible and keeping your core tight and feet elevated, lower the end of the bar with control to the ground on one side of your body, then contract your obliques to return the bar to the center. Repeat on the other side.\
Repeat for the desired number of reps.\

instructions: Start on your knees and extend your right leg out to the side.\
Raise your right arm above your head and reach towards the left side of the room.\
Gently bend your body to the left side and rest your left hand on your left thigh.\
Look up towards your right hand and hold the pose for a few breaths before switching sides.\

instructions: Start from a seated position with an upright posture.\
Cross your right leg over the left and raise your right arm over your head.\
Lean towards your left and reach with your right arm as far to the left as possible.\
Repeat on the opposite side by crossing the left leg over the right.\
You can do the same exercise against a wall or by holding onto a pull-up bar.\

exercises.title: Eversions
instructions: Sit on a step or low box, preferably with a back support. Extend both legs and wrap the band around the balls of the working foot\
Pass the band around the other foot as shown in the video. Hold the end of the band with the opposite arm of the working foot\
The ankle should be at 90 and turned inwards (inversion) before you start the movement. Turn the ankle out, without moving the rest of the leg.\

exercises.title: Single Leg Bosu Ball Balance 2
instructions: Place the supporting leg on the middle of a bosu ball.\
Keep the knee of the suspended leg slightly bent.\
Try to maintain your balance on the bosu ball while bouncing a tennis ball off the wall.\

exercises.title: Single Leg Balance 2
instructions: Stand upright with a braced core.\
Choose the supporting leg and shift your weight on that, while lifting the other slightly off the ground.\
Try to maintain your balance while bouncing a tennis ball off the wall or ground.\

exercises.title: Alphabet
instructions: Sit on a box or bench\
Keep one foot off the ground by pulling onto your knee, or by crossing one leg over the opposite knee.\
Try to form the letters of the Alphabet with your foot.\

instructions: Start with the barbell on your shoulders in a front rack position, feet hip-width apart. Slightly bend your knees and dip straight down.\
Explosively extend your legs and push the barbell upward, generating momentum with your legs.\
As the bar rises, quickly split your legs (one forward, one back) and drop under the bar, locking your arms overhead.\
Bring your front foot back, then your back foot forward to a stable standing position with the bar locked overhead.\

instructions: Stand against a wall with your back flat, arms at 90 by your sides.\
Slowly raise arms overhead, keeping elbows and wrists in contact with the wall.\

exercises.title: Seated Radial Nerve Slider
instructions: From the seated position bring your arm out to the side with the palm facing back.\
Flex your wrist at the same time you are leaning your head towards your outstretched arm.\
Bend your head away from the the outstretched arm while simultaneously extending the wrist.\

exercises.title: Standing Neck Side Flexions
instructions: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back.\
Lean your head to the side (bring your ear to your shoulder) without shrugging your shoulder or leaning the spine to the side.\

exercises.title: Standing Neck Rotations
instructions: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back.\
Rotate your head from side to side without rounding your shoulders.\

exercises.title: Standing Neck Flexions
instructions: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back.\
Tuck your chin in and drop your head forwards without rounding the back.\

exercises.title: Standing Neck Extensions
instructions: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back.\
Lean your head back trying to keep the front of the neck straight.\
Point your chin to the ceiling.\

exercises.title: Standing Neck Mobility Circumductions
instructions: Pull your shoulders back and away from the ears and straighten the back\
Circumduct the head both clockwise and anti-clockwise making sure you  are working on the end range throughout the movement.\
